result.execSummary:
The defendant James L. Chamberlain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Threats to Injure/Accuse of Crime [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. Continue current treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Sumbit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
**Pay DNA surcharge.  May Not have contact with Mr Livingston, Mr Smith or their place of employment unless requested by Mr Livingston through the agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: 3 MONTHS STAYED.  1 day served.  Sentence may be served in Walworth Co,  Huber allowed for work and treatment.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund.  gb/cp
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Mastanuono.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statements made by:  Scott S., Bob L. and deft's wife.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions; 6 months conditional jail, 3 months is stayed, deft to report to jail on 11/29/14 at 6pm; credit for one day served on conditional jail; sentence may be served in Walworth County; Huber privileges are allowed for work and treatment; submit DNA sample; pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returnd to poster.
Amended

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney C Mastantuono.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Family members of victim present.  State files amended information.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 11/24/14 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
with Atty Mastantuono and Elizabeth/ADA Graveley the FPT of 9/11/14 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as Atty Mastantuono has a conflict; reset to 9/18/14 at 1:15pm.
